citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
On 08/30/2022, during general anesthesia on a pig under an approved protocol, emergency epinephrine was not
immediately available to this animal which arrested and ultimately died. The pig had been anesthetized for approximately
30 minutes and appeared stable when the Attending Veterinarian (AV) stepped away to check on the surgery prep of
another pig. During the 5 minutes she was away, a veterinary technician was present. A document presented for review
indicates the technician was not sufficiently trained in animal anesthesia to cover when the AV stepped away. Upon the
AV’s return, she attempted cardiac resuscitation with chest compressions but could not revive the pig. Epinephrine was
not readily available, and the AV went to another room to retrieve it. A necropsy was performed by the AV with anesthesia
listed as the probable cause of death. As stated by the AV, “Pigs are sensitive to anesthesia, and it is not uncommon for
incidents like this to occur”. As discussed with the AV, a trained technician in animal anesthesia and epinephrine were not
readily available when this emergency occurred. The facility has taken corrective action to prevent recurrence. For the
health and safety of the animals, appropriate methods should be in place in the event of emergencies.
Each research facility shall establish appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and the
availability of emergency care.
To be corrected by close of business August 16, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
On 08/30/2022, during general anesthesia on a pig under an approved protocol, emergency epinephrine was not

Each research facility shall establish appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and the

To be corrected by close of business August 16, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
